FacilityName: City of Fernandina Beach Water Plant #3

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The City of Fernandina Beach, Water Treatment Plant #3 (Facility) complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, OSHA's PSM rule, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The chlorinator system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with the Chlorine Institute standards and the Florida Department of Environmental Protection state regulations.

The Facility is proactive regarding safety at its facility. The Facility has safety programs in place to prevent accidents, as well as respond to accidents, should they occur. The Facility's prevention programs include the following:

Risk Management Plan
Process Safety Management Plan
Hazard Communication
Lock Out/Tag Out
Fall Protection

To prepare for an emergency at the Facility, the operators have been trained in the following:

Resiratory Protection
Emergency Action and Fire Prevention

The operators at the Facility are Florida State Certified professionals. The operators have years of experience safely handling chlorine and have NEVER had an accident involving chlorine that caused deaths, injuries, property, or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.

In the event of an emergency involving involving the chlorinator system or the stored chlorine, it is Facility policy to notify 911 (Fernandina Beach Dispatcher) and request response to the emergency. Additional emergency response can be obtained throught the Nassau County Hazmat Team, if necessary. We have discussed this policy with the City of Fernandina Beach Police and Fire Departments. Fire department personnel have inspected our chlorine system and perform routine safety inspections of the Facility.
